release_summary_ibm.name: GenAI Summary Release - IBM

notes: Feature enhancement : The summary now features a dedicated section offering insights into release quality and readiness. Users can set a monthly limit on token usage. New language models have been integrated with support for WatsonX plugins.

notes: Update business value of associated Jira items.

ucv-ext-azure.name: Azure DevOps

ucv-ext-bitbucket-cloud.name: Bitbucket Cloud

ucv-ext-bitbucket-server.name: Bitbucket Server
ucv-ext-bitbucket-server.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync Bitbucket resources.

notes: Added Regular Expression for Additional branch

ucv-ext-bottleneck-detection.name: Bottleneck Detection
ucv-ext-bottleneck-detection.description: Detect bottlenecks in a Velocity value stream

notes: Removed Manual User Access Key:From current version onwards this plugin will only support Auto Generated User Access Key feature of HCL Accelerate.

Minor Enhancement: We can now identify bottlenecks for individual value streams, resolving the issue of occasionally encountering failures when attempting to identify bottlenecks for all value streams simultaneously.

ucv-ext-circleci.name: CircleCI
ucv-ext-circleci.description: The CircleCI plug-in imports and synchronizes CI/CD data from CircleCI.

notes: Removed Manual User Access Key: From current version onwards this plugin will only support Auto Generated User Access Key feature of HCL Accelerate.
Preventing Installation on Older Versions: This version of Circleci Plugin can only be installed on HCL Accelerate version 3.0.0 and later
Added Category:Build and Deploy are the plugin category of Circleci.

Initial Sync Date Field Added: Under the hidden properties section of add integration page for the plugin an Initial Sync Date field is added. This field is optional and can be used only for the first sync.

ucv-ext-compass.name: DevOps Plan Plugin
ucv-ext-compass.description: The DevOps Plan plug-in imports and synchronizes issues from an DevOps Plan server into an DevOps Velocity server.

notes: Removal of timezone field: Previously, the timezone was configured during plug-in integration setup in Velocity. This option has now been removed, and the timezone is instead retrieved directly from the API.

ucv-ext-control.name: DevOps Control
ucv-ext-control.description: Sync pull request, commit and issues from DevOps Control

notes: Bug fix: APIs for retrieving pull request comments and event timelines have been re-enabled, restoring functionality for the pull request schedule event in the Control plug-in.

ucv-ext-cucumber.name: Cucumber
ucv-ext-cucumber.description: This is a plugin to handle incoming cucumber data

notes: npm wrapper version update for Argo Replacement

ucv-ext-cypress.name: Cypress
ucv-ext-cypress.description: This is a plugin to handle Cypress data

notes: Implemented Parsing for Cypress XML and JSON formats
Syncs with GitHub Plugin to get Dependency Vulnerabilities
Show data in metrics bar
Show data in insights
Used GraphQL queries
GitHub Personal access token required

ucv-ext-ewm.name: IBM Engineering Workflow Management (EWM)
ucv-ext-ewm.description: The EWM plug-in imports work item from an IBM EWM respository as issues in the UrbanCode Velocity server.

notes: Fixed an issue where invalid date formats were causing errors in date processing due to a change in the EWM API date format.

ucv-ext-fortify-ssc.name: Fortify SSC
ucv-ext-fortify-ssc.description: The Fortify SSC plug-in handles incoming data from Fortify SSC server.

notes: Added WorkflowId: Under the hidden properties section of add integration page for the plugin a Workflow ID field is added. This field is optional and can be used to provide WorkflowId - the ID of a Value Stream (VSM )to which the vulnerability data is associated.

Bug fix: GitHub integration was not happening second time, it was using existing integration, as apiUrl was not unique in workflow.json file under VSMCookBooks integration properties of GitHub. In older version of GitHub URL field was removed, plugin was looking for apiUrl.
Support for draft pull request: In 1.4.19 release of GitHub this feature added, incorporated same in demo data generator plugin.

ucv-ext-github.name: Github
ucv-ext-github.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync Github resources.

notes: Add description field to Pull Request: Updated GitHub plugin to sync over PR description. In GitHubMapper function under mapGitPullRequests added description field (description: pr.bodyText).
Support version 5.0.11: Our current version of GitHub Integration, only supports Velocity versions 5.0.11 and later.

ucv-ext-gitlab.name: GitLab
ucv-ext-gitlab.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync commits and merge requests from GitLab.

notes: Bug fix: Fixed approvers/reviews data not present in the pullRequest data.

ucv-ext-handlebars-reporter.name: Handlebars Reporter
ucv-ext-handlebars-reporter.description: This plugin will take a Handlebars template and a context generator to create UCV reports

notes: Remove required UAK in favor of dynamically generated UAK

ucv-ext-jenkins.name: Jenkins
ucv-ext-jenkins.description: The Jenkins plugin imports jobs and builds from a Jenkins server. It also runs Jenkins jobs as automation tasks.

notes: Minor bug fix: The Jenkins task in deployment remains incomplete when the Velocity instance goes down during deployment. When the instance comes back online with the new version, the task still does not get marked as complete.

ucv-ext-jira.name: Jira
ucv-ext-jira.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync Jira resources.

notes: Bug fix: Prevented the deletion of old history records in the issue collection normalization. Older history entries from before the last run are needed, as they are used for agile churn analysis.

ucv-ext-jira-service-management.name: Jira Service Management
ucv-ext-jira-service-management.description: Imports incidents from a Jira Service Management instance.

notes: Sync incidents.

ucv-ext-leankit.description: This plug-in imports data from LeanKit

notes: Retrieves Leankit Cards details
Fetch multiple board cards
Image size reduction
Bug fixes

ucv-ext-rally.name: Rally

notes: Removed Manual User Access Key: From current version onwards this plugin will only support Auto Generated User Access Key feature of HCL Accelerate.
Preventing Installation on Older Versions: This version of Rally Plugin can only be installed on HCL Accelerate version 3.0.0 and later
Added Category:ALM is the plugin category of Rally.

Initial Sync Date Field Added: Under the hidden properties section of add integration page for the plugin an Initial Sync Date field is added. This field is optional and can be used only for the first sync.

ucv-ext-rtas.name: Rational Test Automation Server
ucv-ext-rtas.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync RTAS metrics.

notes: Minor bug fix:Fixed bug related to test results URL generated in plugin.
Removed Manual User Access Key: From current version onwards this plugin will only support Auto Generated User Access Key feature of HCL Accelerate.

Added WorkflowId: Under the hidden properties section of add integration page for rational-test-automation-server plugin a Workflow ID field is added. This field is optional and can be used to provide HCL Accelerate WorkflowId - the ID of a Value Stream (VSM )to which rational-test-automation-server vulnerability data is associated.

ucv-ext-sap-charm.name: SAP Charm
ucv-ext-sap-charm.description: Sync issue data from Jira and SAP.

notes: Initial release syncs SAP Normal changes with Jira issues

ucv-ext-servicenow.name: ServiceNow
ucv-ext-servicenow.description: Allows UrbanCode Velocity to sync change requests and incident from ServiceNow.

notes: Feature enhancement: ServiceNow now supports user-defined fields. To enable mapping of these fields to Velocity fields, a custom field mapping option has been introduced in the index.js file within the ServiceNow plugin. Additionally, ServiceNow allows custom values for any field. To implement the change failure rate matrix, it is essential to determine which change requests have a failed status, making value mapping necessary.

ucv-ext-shell.name: Shell
ucv-ext-shell.description: This plugin will execute simple shell scripts

notes: Minor enhancement in code: Enabled to throw error logs while executing shell automation task.

Works with GitHub,GitLab and Bitbucket integrations
Vulnerabilities will be displayed as Application vulnerabilities in metrics bar
